Sections.Text: January 17, 1934. Opening night at The Museum of Occult Antiquities, presented by The Tyree Trust.
SOME GUY, the museum's curator, has assembled the greatest collection of arcane artifact in the world, many of which were already in the old house when he bought it.
Of course, such treasures will prove an incredible temptation to some of the less savory supernatural entities in the world. The security team is on guard against potential threats.
An ancient entity has infiltrated the museum disguised as a normal patron.
The creature is stealing artifacts from the museum, presumably to use in some dangerous ritual. The team must watch the suspicious-looking visitors closely.
The more artifacts the ancient one collects, the faster his ritual will be and the more monsters he will summon to protect him during the ritual.
Watch the visitors closely - if any of them move preturnaturally fast or is in a suspicious location when an artifact is stolen, they might be the ancient one.
Attacking the disguised ancient one will reveal him, but attacking an innoncent, wealthy patron will result in the security member being arrested and removed from the museum.
But if he is attacked by security while in disguise, Ses-kalla will be forced to start the ritual immediately.
